title: SB 1.19.26-28 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 29-05-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse

The meaning of this verse is, his collarbone was fleshy, his chest broad and thick, his navel deep and his abdomen beautifully striped.
His arms were long and curly hair was strewn over his beautiful face.
The face was already described in the previous verse, beautiful face.
He was naked and the hue of his body reflected that of Lord Krishna.
Lord Krishna is very dark complexion.
Similarly, Shukadev Goswami was also dark complexion like Krishna.
So, Srila Prabhupada explains these bodily features of Shukadev Goswami.
In the purport, his bodily features indicate him to be different from common men.
Distinct features are there by which he can be distinguished as an extraordinary personality, even among great persons.
So, Srila Prabhupada says, all the signs described in connection with the bodily features of Shukadev Goswami are uncommon symptoms.
Great personalities according to physiognomical calculations.
See, there are many branches of Vedic knowledge.
One of them is how to recognize a person's greatness by studying his external features.
